Module hanyaeger
Package com.github.hanyaeger.api.scenes

Class ScrollableDynamicScene

java.lang.Object
com.github.hanyaeger.core.YaegerGameObject
com.github.hanyaeger.api.scenes.StaticScene
com.github.hanyaeger.api.scenes.DynamicScene
com.github.hanyaeger.api.scenes.ScrollableDynamicScene
All Implemented Interfaces:
YaegerScene, Activatable, Clearable, DependencyInjector, Destroyable, Effectable, DragRepositoryAccessor, GameNode, Initializable, RootPaneProvider, com.github.hanyaeger.core.scenes.DimensionsProvider, com.github.hanyaeger.core.scenes.EntityCollectionSupplier, com.github.hanyaeger.core.scenes.EntitySpawnerListProvider, com.github.hanyaeger.core.scenes.SupplierProvider, com.github.hanyaeger.core.scenes.TileMapListProvider, TimerListProvider, Updatable, UpdateDelegator
public abstract class ScrollableDynamicScene extends DynamicScene
A ScrollableDynamicScene has exactly the same behaviour as a DynamicScene, but adds the option to differ between the viewable area and the actual window size. The size of the viewable are can be set with the method setSize(Size), which should be called from the lifecycle method YaegerScene.setupScene().

The main area of a ScrollableDynamicScene is scrollable and all instances of YaegerEntity are added to this scrollable area. However, additional to the DynamicScene, a ScrollableDynamicScene exposes an overloaded addEntity(YaegerEntity, boolean), which accepts a second parameter. By setting this to true, the YaegerEntity is added to a non-scrollable layer, which is placed above the scrollable layer.

Since the size of the actual window size is usually much larger than the viewable area is, it is necessary set which part can be seen. For this, the horizontal and vertical scroll position can be set, with both relative values (setRelativeScrollPosition(double, double), or separately through setVerticalRelativeScrollPosition(double) and setHorizontalRelativeScrollPosition(double)) or absolute values (setScrollPosition(Coordinate2D), or separately through setHorizontalScrollPosition(double) and setVerticalScrollPosition(double)).

  • Constructor Details

    • ScrollableDynamicScene

      public ScrollableDynamicScene()

  • Method Details

    • setSize

      protected void setSize(Size size)
      Set the Size (e.g. the width and height) of the scrollable area of the YaegerScene. By default, the with and height are set to the width and height of the YaegerGame.
      Parameters:
      size - the Size of the scrollable area of the YaegerScene

    • setHorizontalRelativeScrollPosition

      public void setHorizontalRelativeScrollPosition(double horizontalRelativeScrollPosition)
      Set the horizontal scroll position of the scene to a relative value. A value of 0 (or smaller) will mean the viewport is positioned on the utmost left of the scene. A value of 1 or greater places the viewport on the utmost right of the scene.
      Parameters:
      horizontalRelativeScrollPosition - a double between 0 and 1. A double below 0 will be handled as 0 and a double greater than 1 will be treated as 1.

    • setVerticalRelativeScrollPosition

      public void setVerticalRelativeScrollPosition(double verticalRelativeScrollPosition)
      Set the vertical scroll position of the scene to a relative value. A value of 0 (or smaller) will mean the viewport is positioned on the top of the scene. A value of 1 or greater places the viewport on the bottom of the scene.
      Parameters:
      verticalRelativeScrollPosition - a double between 0 and 1. A double below 0 will be handled as 0 and a double greater than 1 will be treated as 1.

    • setRelativeScrollPosition

      public void setRelativeScrollPosition(double horizontalRelativeScrollPosition, double verticalRelativeScrollPosition)
      Set the scroll position of the scene to the relative x and y-value provided. Both values should be between 0 and 1. An x-value of 0 (or smaller) will mean the viewport is positioned on the utmost left of the scene. An x-value of 1 or greater places the viewport on the utmost right of the scene.

      A y-value of 0 (or smaller) will mean the viewport is positioned on the top of the scene. A y-value of 1 or greater places the viewport on the bottom of the scene.

      Parameters:
      horizontalRelativeScrollPosition - a double between 0 and 1. A double below 0 will be handled as 0 and a double greater than 1 will be treated as 1.
      verticalRelativeScrollPosition - a double between 0 and 1. A double below 0 will be handled as 0 and a double greater than 1 will be treated as 1.

    • setHorizontalScrollPosition

      public void setHorizontalScrollPosition(double horizontalScrollPosition)
      Set the horizontal scroll position of the scene. A value of 0 (or smaller) will mean the viewport is positioned on the utmost left of the scene. A value equal or greater than the width of the scene places the viewport on the utmost right of the scene.
      Parameters:
      horizontalScrollPosition - a double between 0 and the width of the scene. A double below 0 will be handled as 0 and a double greater than the width of the scene will be treated as the width of the scene.

    • setVerticalScrollPosition

      public void setVerticalScrollPosition(double verticalScrollPosition)
      Set the vertical scroll position of the scene. A value of 0 (or smaller) will mean the viewport is positioned on the utmost top of the scene. A value equal or greater than the height of the scene places the viewport on the bottom of the scene.
      Parameters:
      verticalScrollPosition - a double between 0 and the height of the scene. A double below 0 will be handled as 0 and a double greater than the height of the scene will be treated as the height of the scene.

    • setScrollPosition

      public void setScrollPosition(Coordinate2D coordinate2D)
      Set the scroll position of the scene centered on the given Coordinate2D.
      Parameters:
      coordinate2D - the Coordinate2D on which the ScrollableDynamicScene should be centered.

    • getHorizontalRelativeScrollPosition

      public double getHorizontalRelativeScrollPosition()
      Return the current horizontal scroll position of the viewport. The ScrollableDynamicScene will update this value whenever the viewport is scrolled.

      The value will be a double between 0 and 1, where a 0 will mean the viewport is positioned at the left of the scrollable area. A value of 1 will mean the viewport will be positioned at the end of the scrollable area.

      Returns:
      a double between 0 and 1 (inclusive)

    • getVerticalRelativeScrollPosition

      public double getVerticalRelativeScrollPosition()
      Return the current vertical scroll position of the viewport. The ScrollableDynamicScene will update this value whenever the viewport is scrolled.

      The value will be a double between 0 and 1, where a 0 will mean the viewport will be positioned at the top of the scrollable area. A value of 1 will mean the viewport will be positioned at the end of the scrollable area.

      Returns:
      a double between 0 and 1 (inclusive)

    • addEntity

      protected void addEntity(YaegerEntity yaegerEntity, boolean stickyOnViewport)
      Add an YaegerEntity to this YaegerScene.
      Parameters:
      yaegerEntity - the YaegerEntity to be added
      stickyOnViewport - true if this YaegerEntity should be placed on the viewport, false if this YaegerEntity should be part of the scrollable area.

    • getWidth

      public double getWidth()
      Return the width of the complete scene. Note that this concerns the complete area of the scrollable scene, not only the part that is visible (the viewport).

      If only the width of the viewport is required, use the method getViewportWidth()

      Returns:
      the width of the complete scene, as a double

    • getViewportWidth

      public double getViewportWidth()
      Return the width of the viewport.

      If the full width of the scene is required, use the method getWidth().

      Returns:
      the width of the viewport, as a double

    • getHeight

      public double getHeight()
      Return the height of the complete scene. Note that this concerns the complete area of the scrollable scene, not only the part that is visible (the viewport).

      If only the height of the viewport is required, use the method getViewportHeight()

      Returns:
      the height of the complete scene, as a double

    • setPaneFactory

      @Inject public void setPaneFactory(PaneFactory paneFactory)
      Description copied from class: StaticScene
      Set the PaneFactory to be used. The PaneFactory will be used to create the root node of the graph that will be constructed for this Scene.

      Note: This method is part of the internal API, and should not be used when implementing a Yaeger game.

      Overrides:
      setPaneFactory in class StaticScene
      Parameters:
